cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi W of Cabo Cruz, Cuba / 100 mi S of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central-western Cuba Monday, then turning north-northwest over the Florida Straits and up the eastern Gulf, curving inland across Georgia/South Carolina and eventually re-emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (near the Big Bend/Tampa-Cedar Key region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches extend from Flamingo, FL northward to the Anclote River on Florida’s west coast (plus Florida Keys and Florida Bay).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings currently confined to portions of Cuba and the Lower/Middle Florida Keys.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Gulf coast, then inland across south-central Georgia into the coastal Carolinas and southeastern Mid-Atlantic shoreline.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a low (≤12%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds Wednesday; gusts 30–40 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast based on current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated amounts to 6 inches Tuesday night through Wednesday, creating risk of urban and minor river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible within outer rain-bands; brief squalls could disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations.
